22 . Honma et al. investigated the inhibitory activities of several diaryl urea derivatives against CDK-4 19. The results revealed higher kinase inhibitory activity for the derivatives with the bulky aryl moiety when substituted with H-bond donner (HB D)/acceptor (HB A) groups. Among these derivatives, compound 6 with the bulky 7-hydroxynaphthalen-1-yl moiety inhibited CDK-4 with an IC 50 value of 7.6 μM, Figure 2. Compound 7 (CDKi 277, Figure 2) is also a thiazolyl urea derivative which exhibited potent ATP competitive inhibitory activity against CDKs 1, 2, and 5 with IC 50 values of 8, 4, and 5 nM, respectively
